items.question: When is this year's annual conference? Where will it be held?
items.answer: 2023 annual conference will be held on April 22nd and 23rd at Kuanhe Exhibition Hall in New Taipei City.

items.question: What activites are included in this year's annual conference?
items.answer: We have arranged a series of keynote speeches and educational sessions in the two-day program. On the night of 22nd, there will be an gala dinner where you can enjoy great food and great performance brought by outstanding Toastmasters.

items.question: How can I buy the annual conference tickets?
items.answer: Please register and log in to the website, and click on "new order" on my account page to buy the tickets. Please refer to the tutorial for more details. Thank you.

items.question: Can I get a refund for the tickets I bought in case I couldn't attend the annual conference?
items.answer: Please email your refund request to tmicon{'@'}toastmasters.org.tw by April 13th for the manual refund process. No refund is allowed after this deadline.</br></br>In addition, we will charget 10% handling fee for each refund request sent to us by April 13th. The refund will be transferred to your bank account by April 30th.

items.question: Who can I contact if I have questions regarding the annual conference?
items.answer: Please email your request to tmicon{'@'}toastmasters.org.tw. We will respond shortly.

items.question: Is there any recommended accommodation near the venue?
items.answer: Please visit our accommodation info page for more information.

text.desktop: It is our great pleasure to welcome you to the 2024 Annual Conference of the Toastmasters International D67 in Taipei. Learn to improve your public speaking, leadership, and communication skills through an exciting 2-day program of keynote speeches, speech contests and training sessions.
text.mobile: Come join the exciting 2-day program of keynote speeches, speech contests and training sessions.

speakers.name: Stan Shih
speakers.title: Keynote Speaker (Mandarin)/ Acer Inc. Founder/ StanShih Foundation Chairman
contents: Mr. Shih is the Founder and Honorary Chairman of Acer Inc., Chairman of StanShih Foundation, Director of Acer and Nan Shan Life Insurance Co., Ltd. and a past Director of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company. He has been promoting the way of benevolent governance, proactively driving the elevation of Taiwan’s industrial transformation, enhancing Taiwan’s competitive sustainability, standing on the edge of the scale balancing “culture” and “technology.” He has been acting as “the driver of culture and technology integration” to create value across domains.

BusinessWeek named Mr. Shih one of its “25 Top Managers of the Year” in 1996. He was featured in Time Magazine’s “60 Years of Asian Heroes” in 2006 to recognize him for his contribution to the global IT industry. In 2007, he served as the President’s envoy at the 15th APEC Economic Leader’s Summit in Sydney, Australia. For his long-term contributions, the President honored him with the Order of Brilliant Star with Grand Cordon in October 2011 and the 1st Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI) Laureate in 2012. In 2021, he was also awarded the Taiwan Cultural Collaboration Medal by the Ministry of Culture.

Mr. Shih earned his bachelors, masters, and honorary doctorate in electronics engineering from the National Chiao Tung University. He was also awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Technology by Hong Kong Polytechnic University, made an honorary fellow of the University of Wales, awarded an Honorary Doctorate of International Law from the Thunderbird School of Global Management, and awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Fine Arts by the Tainan National University of the Arts.

seminars.topic: Discussing Taiwan’s Competitiveness Through the Thinking of Wangdao
introduction: “New Wangdao” is a discussion of the way of leaders in organizations of various sizes. “Value creation, the balance of interests, and sustainable development” are the three core concepts of Wangdao thinking. Wangdao emphasizes looking at the total value of things through the “Six-Aspect Values.” Pay greater attention to the “intangible, indirect, future” invisible value in addition to the “tangible, direct, and present” dominant value. Build a new mechanism for mutual value creation and the balance of interests through continuous creativity and value creation. Only then can the goal of sustainable development be realized.

Taiwan is already Si-nnovation. Facing the new and future challenges of the world, we need to make Taiwan the birthplace of Si-vilization. In the past, Taiwan has served as the main contributor of the world’s electronic products and material civilization. Hopefully in the future, Taiwan can contribute to the future spiritual civilization of mankind. Taiwan can position itself as a friend of the world.

This year, the theme of the annual conference is “Connect to the Present, Lead the Future.” It fits perfectly with the thinking of Wangdao and its mission of leading Taiwan towards the future. Standing on the foundation of Taiwan’s current ICT and electronics industries, we can further lead future cross-domain and integration applications, develop smart medicine, cultural technology, smart agriculture, etc. We can contribute to our island, the international community, and the global environment.

speakers.name: Greg Van Borssum
speakers.title: Keynote Speaker (English)/ Accredited Speaker
contents: • Australia’s first accredited speaker
• Academy Award Winning Best Animated Film “Happy Feet” Assistant Director
• Academy Award Winning Film “Mad Max: Fury Road” Choreographer and Actor
• 2016 Screen Actors Guild Award Winner
• 2014 World Champion Pistol Winner
• Australian National Bodybuilding Champion
• National Mental Health Ambassador
• International Karate Master

seminars.topic: Remastermind - How a Failed School Kid Mastered His Mindset to Become a Champion
introduction: When people look at Greg’s life, they only see the result. They don’t see the years of failures; they don’t feel the years of pain, and they don’t hear the negative voices from his childhood that echoed so loudly through his mind.

His primary teachers told him he would amount to nothing, high school teachers said he’d be the most likely student to be in prison or dead by 21... but no matter what they said, Greg refused to listen.
Instead, he immersed himself into the worlds of martial arts and bodybuilding, absorbed life lessons from the influential people closest to him, and used them to temper his body and mind.

Greg turned his life around, becoming the World’s youngest Professional Natural Bodybuilder, a World champion pistol shooter, Award Winning Hollywood Action Choreographer and director, and the Southern Hemispheres only Toastmasters Accredited Speaker.
It’s time to learn what it takes to master your mindset with Greg Van Borssum “Remastermind - how a failed school kid mastered his mindset to become a champion.”

seminars.topic: Team Survival Skills from Antarctica to the Apocalypse
introduction: The skills of leadership are some of the most important life skills you could ever wish to cultivate. Learning how to persuade, speak, present and influence, to me are some of the most imperative.
Anyone can lead when times are good, but it’s in a time of crisis, when the pressure is on, and things aren’t going your way, when true leadership comes to the fore.

Over the past 25 years Greg has pushed boundaries, from being a multiple national and a world champion sportsman, to spearheading some of Hollywood’s biggest films. In his time, he has led teams of up to 1000 people, in high pressure, high danger environments and all under massive time constraints.

In this workshop, Greg will go through the lessons he learned whilst putting his face to the fire, from his competition years to making films, Happy feet, Happy Feet 2 and Mad Max Fury Road with the films winning a total of 7 Academy Awards.
It’s time to learn “Team survival skills from Antarctica to the Apocalypse.”

speakers.name: Samantha Tu
speakers.title: Trainer of the English Training Session
contents: • Lecturer of business etiquette and tea culture in National Changhua University of Education
• Tea master & Trainer of tea master etiquette of Huixin Tea Culture Development Association
• Public Relations manager of Toastmasters international, D67, 2020-2021

seminars.topic: Come Have a Cup of Tea - Reconnect to the World through Tea
introduction: ”Come have a cup of tea” used to be an authentic greeting in traditional Taiwanese society.
It showed the hospitality of Taiwanese people and indicated the important role that tea has played in Taiwanese life.
The power of tea is much more than you can image.
It is not only one of the top 3 popular drinks worldwide, tea also provides more health advantages than others, most of all, tea is an elegant way for us to reconnect to the world after the pandemic.

speakers.name: Angel Li
speakers.title: Trainer of the English Training Session
contents: Angel Li has been joining Toastmasters since she was a freshman in National Taiwan University.

If you want to know how an introvert girl who dare not speak English can be transformed by 16-year Toastmasters journey into a global project manager in clinical research industries, you should come to listen to her inspiring stories.

Angel has become a mother of a baby girl since year 2022 while she is seeking for a new record and striving for a new height in her career. She achieves all the milestones and timeline at work, cooks for almost every meal for family, and keep me-time and own hobbies at the same time. If you want to know how a working mother can balance her career, life and family elegantly, you should come to listen to her tips for time management skills.

seminars.topic: Manage Your Time, Master Your Life
introduction: Time flies, but the good news is you are the pilot. If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable. Your life is like a candle. Every bit of melted wax vanishes forever and shall never be recovered. We will only be able to be productive when we truly strive to protect and make the most of our time.

Focus 100% of your energy, your time and your life to getting what is really important to you. Accept only what really matters in your lives. Simplify your life. Eliminate anything trivial, everything that is superfluous. There’s no greater joy than working to achieve what really matters to you.

Angel who serves as a global project manager in clinical research industries, a mother of one-year old baby and a life master has been implementing strong time management skills to strike for an elegant balance of her life. She is going to share her practical tips of managing your time by mastering your life.
You will learn:
• The impact of pre-occupation to your efficiency.
• The decision diagrams.
• Identify the 3Ts, the three most important tasks to carry out in the day.
• One by one, only once and till the end.

speakers.name: Phillip Botha
speakers.title: Trainer of the English Training Session
contents: Phillip has been a Toastmaster for about 8 years.
During that time, he served in several leadership roles including VPM and President of Taipei Tech (NTUT) Toastmasters Club plus VPM and VPPR of Premium Toastmasters Club.
In 2019 Phillip participated in the D67 International Speech Contest where he made it to the finals held in Kaohsiung City.
Phillip is currently a member of the Good Life Toastmasters Club.
Phillip’s personal struggle with low self-confidence and self-esteem has motivated him to become a student and teacher in these fields.
In 2018 he traveled to Orlando, Florida where he became certified as a John C. Maxwell Coach, Teacher, Trainer, and Speaker.
His passion for teaching and helping others has led him to conduct this training program.

seminars.topic: Be Your Own Hero: How to Overcome Self-Doubt and Be The Most Confident You
introduction: Do you ever feel that a lack of self-confidence is holding you back from being the best version of yourself and accomplishing your biggest dreams?
In this training, you’ll discover what self-confidence really is, and receive an action-based blueprint for overcoming self-doubt and building and maintaining optimal levels of confidence.
You will learn how to take control of your own personal growth and become the hero of your own story.

speakers.name: 林惠君
speakers.title: 國語教育訓練講師
contents: Please be noted that this training will be conducted in Mandarin; therefore, only Mandarin introduction is provided. Thank you.
林惠君是亞洲知名催眠師、企業諮詢顧問，以幽默和務實的教學風格著稱，其發明「中國哲學五行卡」號稱東方塔羅牌，該卡片已成為華人卜算的重要工具。
講師以獨特的生命經歷和好奇心滿滿的性格，讓她在各領域展露頭角，其專業包括催眠、心理、哲學、茶葉品評、調酒，於2015年被評選為優良教師，更在全國演講大賽中斬獲多次冠軍。

introduction: 在ＡＩ時代更需要運用充滿人性的溝通來領導未來，真實的人生經驗和互動能為心理帶來安慰，運用哲學的的思維和腦神經為本的串連能為生命創造更多的彈性。
本次教育訓練將採工作坊模式進行，讓資深企業諮詢師帶領你從語言、哲學、心理進行充滿人性的超效溝通法。
準備來一場從腦神經到末稍神經的洗禮，用最符合人性的心理學教你超效溝通，專屬 Toastmasters 的講座，千萬別錯過！

speakers.name: 王玉梅
speakers.title: 國語教育訓練講師
contents: Please be noted that this training will be conducted in Mandarin; therefore, only Mandarin introduction is provided. Thank you.
• 學歷：東吳大學法律系學士；企管系EMBA碩士
• 經歷：1984-2022服務於東吳大學（已退休）
• 東吳校友總會監事
• 東吳企管EMBA聯合會監事
• 東吳女籃校友會會長
• 東吳前兩岸事務中心主任（從事兩岸學術交流26年）
• 海峽兩岸交流基金會2023年顧問（無給職）
• 演講及主持經歷：
• 中文演講會22年資深會員、喜洋洋中文演講會顧問
• 2000年國語備稿演講比賽冠軍、2002年台語即席比賽冠軍
• 多次參與國際演講會大會教育訓練及1次春季大會晚會主持
• 主持演講會會友結婚喜宴、主持演講會會友公司春酒午宴
• 主持訪問姚明見面會、主持800人年終尾牙
• 主持14場大陸同學來台交流大型活動開、閉幕典禮

introduction: 大家好！我是喜洋洋中文國際演講會王玉梅，很榮幸受邀在2023年春季大會的教育訓練工作坊中，和大家一起分享和學習。
個人參加演講會超過20年，雖然只完成40篇演講，但每篇演講都是「以口說心，人稿合一」的體現，就像談了40場傾心以對，轟轟烈烈的戀愛！因此，「心口稿三合一」始終是我個人對演講舞台的態度和信念。
從小因多次參加演講比賽的經驗，讓我對「上台演講」並不陌生，但是在參加演講會之前，「主持」這件事，我可就一無所知。直到透過例會的總主持人、開懷、即席再到總講評等等的學習，才培養出我對「主持」的興趣和能力，也因為具備「主持能力」，
無論是演講或主持，每位會友都有自己獨特的風格，20年多來，我像個園丁或農夫，守著演講舞台的一畝三分地，深耕勤耘，產出不多，但都是誠心之作，能常常和會友們分享，就是最歡喜的收穫！回首演講會一路走來，真心感受「惠我良多」，如今退休成為「時間富婆」，理當盡己之力感恩回饋！
古云「溫故知新」，期待4月23日能和舊雨們重新溫故，也能和新知們共同學習，我們一起來杯「心口稿三合一」下午茶，輕鬆聊聊「主持二、三事」吧！

speakers.name: 張志良
speakers.title: 國語教育訓練講師
contents: Please be noted that this training will be conducted in Mandarin; therefore, only Mandarin introduction is provided. Thank you.
• 現任翔威國際（華碩電腦子公司）副總經理
• 2017年加入國際演講會
• 2019年榮獲國語演講比賽第二名
• 2021年榮獲國語演講比賽第一名

introduction: 以系統的方法，將創意導入文字文稿中，因而產生不同的趣味。有興趣的會友，歡迎一起來玩！

speakers.name: 黃東竣
speakers.title: 台語教育訓練講師
contents: Please be noted that this training will be conducted in Taiwanese; therefore, only Taiwaneseintroduction is provided. Thank you.
• 2016年國語演講比賽第一名
• 2017年台語演講比賽第一名

introduction: 台語是咱A母語！
講台語是一件很浪漫A代誌！
有很多話，用台語來講才有伊特殊A感情甲效果！
但是愈來愈少人用台語來交流！
我感覺非常A難過！
我去思考為什麼會發生這種代誌？
我發現是因為大部份A人～感覺講台語卡沒水準！
這個結果，是因為電視上面～台語攏是用來罵人耶！
但是，事實不是這樣耶！
現在乎咱開始來學習講優美A台語、咱開始來愛講咱A母語。
只有咱開始愛講台語，咱A囝仔才會也愛講台語！

speakers.name: Chika Hisamatsu
speakers.title: 日本語ワークショップ講師
contents: Please be noted that this training will be conducted in Japanese; therefore, only Japaneseintroduction is provided. Thank you.
神奈川の馬車道トーストマスターズクラブ、広島のもみじトーストマスターズクラブに所属しています。
Toastmasters歴は20年以上で、例会やコンテストなどを通して論評力を磨いてきました。
2005年、2009年に国際スピーチコンテストの日本代表となった経験から、みなさんとスピーチをより良くする論評について考えていきたいと思います。

seminars.topic: 「誰でもできる！これが論評の基本形」
introduction: 論評に苦手意識はありませんか？実は論評には基本的な流れがあり、これさえ理解すれば誰でも短時間で簡単にまとめることができます。
ワークショップではワークシートを使って実際に日本語スピーチへの論評にチャレンジしていただきます。よい論評でみなさんのクラブの例会を盛り上げましょう！

title: Meet our team of
Designers
Developers
, and
Digital Experts.
team.description: We are a group of passionate volunteers under the D67 Digital Transformation Committee. We are dedicated to creating an optimal digital experience for the Toastmasters community.

car.title: By Car
steps: Get off National Highway No.1 at the Xizhi Interchange, turn right at Section 2 of Datong Road, and go straignt to reach No. 237 on Section 1 of Datong Road.

Get off National Highway No.3 at the Xintai 5th Road Interchange, turn left at Xintai 5th Road, turn right at Section 1 of Datong Road, and make a u-turn at the second traffic light, and then go straight to reach Kuanhe.

metro.title: By Metro
metro.content: Take Taipei Metro Bannan Line or Wenhu Line to reach Nangang Exhibition Center Station.
steps: Take a taxi to reach Kuanhe which costs around NT$100.
Go to exit no. 6 and take a bus (B21, B22, B23, 919, 605 817, 668) to South Zhangshuwan Station, and then walk to reach Kuanhe.

bus.title: By Bus
bus.content: Take 605, 668, 817, or Keelung Bus to South Zhangshuwan Station, and then walk to reach Kuanhe.
